intro: Crepis nutans, commonly known as the nodding sowthistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive basal rosette. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Crepis nutans is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it often grows in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields.
